page.title: 05OLD ELDON, CO. DURHAM
page.content: The hamlet of{Old Eldon}comprises of some nine houses. The largest of these is the farmstead named{Eldon {Hall Farm.}The land is owned by Lord Eldon and managed by Mr. Harrison. {Eldon Hall Farm}is a substantial building which, with its adjacent outbuildings, possibly dates from the Georgian period. The hamlet is situated on a minor crossroads which lead to adjacent villages including Eldon, once a thriving mining community. The land surrounding the hamlet is mainly agricultural. The majority of the area is situated on broken ground used for grazing, with the disused Eldon Quarry used as a tip, predominating the landscape. The remaining fields are used as arable land, crops grown include barley and oil seed rape.
